data.title: After Hours: Amazon Is Defeated in Court
data.text: The big retailer suffers a legal setback.

data.title: Public records reveal another potential giant Amazon tower in Bellevue
data.text: Amazon’s plan to build its tallest tower yet in Bellevue, the city 10 miles east of Seattle that has become a focal point for the tech giant’s recent growth, could be just the beginning of the company’s ambitions for the prime site that will eventually be home to some crucial teams.

data.title: Amazon reportedly hiring 2K workers for Alexa, drone projects
data.text: The e-commerce giant is hiring engineers, data scientists and other roles in the UK, according to a report.

data.title: Dow Jones Futures: Apple, FANGs Near Buy Points; Which Will Be Stock Market Rally Winners?
data.text: Stock futures: Apple and FANG stocks Facebook, Amazon and Netflix are near buy points. But which of these tech titans are likely winners in the current stock market rally?

data.title: Appeals court rules Amazon can be held liable for third-party products
data.text: In a blow to Amazon, a U.S. appeals court ruled that the mega-retailer can be held accountable for fault third-party sales.

data.title: Federal appeals court says Amazon is liable for third-party sellers' products
data.text: A federal appeals court ruled on Wednesday that Amazon can be held liable for for defective goods that third-party vendors sell on its site.

data.title: Growing Number of Tech Giants Looking to Move Production Out of China
data.text: Companies caught in the crossfire of the trade war are exploring alternatives.

data.title: Taylor Swift, Will Smith among the celebs joining Amazon for a Prime Day push into new categories
data.text: Amazon Prime Day’s biggest attraction may be the all the deals and discounts, but celebrities like Will Smith and Kristen Bell are a close second.

data.title: Amazon responds to a U.S. Senator’s inquiry, confirms Alexa voice records are kept indefinitely
data.text: Amazon has responded to a letter of inquiring it received from U.S. Senator Chris Coons (D-DE) which asks the company to detail what happens to customers’ Alexa voice records and data after they speak to their virtual assistant.

data.title: Amazon can be held liable for third-party seller products: U.S. appeals court
data.text: A federal appeals court on Wednesday ruled against Amazon.com Inc  in a case that could expose the online retailer to lawsuits from customers who buy defective products from third-party vendors through its website.

data.title: HP, Dell, Microsoft, and Amazon looking to shift some production out of China: report
data.text: The Nikkei Asian Review reported Wednesday that HP Inc. HPQ, +0.33% Dell Technologies Inc.

data.title: Amazon on a Hiring Spree, to Add More Than 2K Jobs in Britain
data.text: Amazon (AMZN) plans to add more than 2,000 permanent jobs in Britain this year.

data.title: Disruptor Alert: 3 Companies Changing the E-Commerce Landscape
data.text: Amazon tops the list, of course, but don't overlook Shopify and PayPal.

data.title: Inside an Amazon Warehouse, Robots’ Ways Rub Off on Humans
data.text: A machine-dominated workplace can make employees more mechanical themselves. But there is room for initiative, and small acts of rebellion.
